Name: Viwe mfaku

with Ogilvy Cape Town', 'Industry': 'Food', 'Description': "I worked as a brand designer on the South by Africa Visual brand identity for KFC Africa. Our main goal was to enhance local appeal and accurately represent the diverse markets KFC Africa was targeting.

We aimed to establish a strong connection between KFC and the African consumer base by localizing the brand's visual look and feel. We analyzed each target market carefully, considering their distinct characteristics, traditions, and visual aesthetics. Our aim was to incorporate culturally relevant elements while maintaining KFC's global brand recognition and consistency.

Through this local adaptation, we wanted to create familiarity, trust, and emotional connection with African consumers. By using culturally relevant visual cues, colors, patterns, and motifs, we aimed to evoke a sense of pride and ownership among the local communities.

The South by Africa Visual brand identity showcased the diversity of African markets and positioned KFC as a brand that respects and celebrates its consumers' unique identities. By tailoring the visual elements to each market, we ensured effective communication of KFC Africa's value proposition and establishment of a strong regional presence.

Our objective as brand designers was to create a visually compelling and culturally appropriate brand identity that resonates with African consumers, fosters brand loyalty, and supports KFC Africa's expansion into new markets.", 'Skills Used': ['Art Direction', 'Visual Development Art', 'Creative Direction', 'Creative Strategy', 'Layout Design', 'Brand Design', 'Brand Strategy', 'Adobe InDesign', 'Adobe Photoshop']}]

The app has an accompanying admin app where admin can receive orders and update the status of the order', 'Skills Used': ['UX Design', 'Mobile Design', 'UI/UX Design Systems', 'Interactive Design', 'Adobe Illustrator', 'Adobe Photoshop', 'Canva', 'Figma', 'Adobe XD']}, {'Title': 'Bitwyse Mobile Apps Motion Design', 'Role': 'Motion Design', 'Company': 'Bitwyse', 'Industry': 'Creative Agency', 'Description': "Overview:
The Mobile App Motion Design Presentations project aims to enhance the visual appeal and user experience of mobile application demonstrations through captivating motion design techniques. This project focuses on creating dynamic and engaging animated presentations that effectively showcase the features and functionalities of various mobile apps.

Objectives:

Elevate Visual Storytelling: Employ motion design to convey a compelling narrative, effectively communicating the app's purpose, benefits, and unique selling points to the target audience.

Improve User Experience: Implement seamless transitions, intuitive animations, and user-friendly interactions to enhance the overall experience of app presentations.

Highlight App Features: Utilize motion design to draw attention to key app features, emphasizing their importance and demonstrating how they add value to users' lives.

Brand Consistency: Maintain a consistent visual style and adhere to the app's brand guidelines to reinforce brand recognition and coherence throughout the presentation.

Adaptability: Design motion presentations that can be used across various platforms and devices, ensuring compatibility with different screen sizes and resolutions.

Scope of Work:

Research and Concept Development: Conduct in-depth research on each mobile app to gain a comprehensive understanding of its functionalities and target audience. Develop creative concepts for motion design presentations that align with the app's unique identity.

Storyboarding: Create detailed storyboards that outline the flow of the presentation, including key scenes, transitions, and interactions.

Animation and Interaction Design: Bring the storyboards to life by designing captivating animations and user interactions that highlight the app's features and create an immersive experience.

Visual Assets Creation: Design custom visual assets, such as illustrations, icons, and animated characters, to add personality and visual appeal to the presentations.

Iterative Feedback: Collaborate closely with the mobile app development team to gather feedback and make necessary revisions to ensure alignment with the app's objectives.

Deliverables:

Motion Design Presentations: A set of high-quality, captivating motion design presentations for each mobile app, delivered in formats compatible with various devices and platforms.

Source Files: Provide editable source files to enable future updates and modifications if needed.

Timeline:
The project will be completed within 3 weeks from the commencement date, with regular milestones to track progress and ensure timely delivery.

Conclusion:
The Mobile App Motion Design Presentations project seeks to elevate the presentation of mobile apps through the power of motion design, resulting in engaging, visually appealing, and effective demonstrations. By implementing seamless animations and user-friendly interactions, these motion presentations will captivate the audience and leave a lasting impression of the apps' unique features and functionalities.", 'Skills Used': ['2D Animation', '2D Illustration', '2D Motion Graphics', '3D Motion Graphics', 'App Design', 'Interactive Design', 'iOS Design', 'UX Design', 'Mobile Design', 'Adobe XD', 'Adobe After Effects', 'Lottie', 'Proto.io', 'Adobe Premiere Pro', 'ProtoPie', 'Adobe Animate']}, {'Title': 'Logo Motion Design', 'Role': 'Motion Designer', 'Company': 'Floodfix', 'Industry': 'Crypto', 'Description': 'Floodfix Logo Motion Design', 'Skills Used': ['2D Motion Graphics', '2D Animation', '3D Motion Graphics', 'Adobe After Effects', 'Adobe Animate']}, {'Title': 'Baking Intelligence Pitch Deck', 'Role': 'Presentation Designer', 'Company': 'Baking Intelligence', 'Industry': 'Commerce', 'Description': "
Introduction:

In this report, I will provide an overview of the presentation conducted for Baking Intelligence, an E-Learning platform focused on empowering female bakers to start their own baking cloud kitchens. The presentation aimed to communicate the benefits and implementation strategies of using the Baking Intelligence platform to help aspiring female bakers set up successful cloud kitchens.

Objective:

The primary objective of the presentation was to showcase how Baking Intelligence's comprehensive E-Learning resources can support female bakers in their entrepreneurial journey by providing valuable insights, guidance, and tools needed to establish and operate efficient cloud kitchens.

Audience:

The audience consisted of key stakeholders, including potential investors, industry experts, and aspiring female bakers interested in the concept of cloud kitchens and E-Learning opportunities.

Presentation Structure:

Introduction to Baking Intelligence:

Highlighted the mission and vision of Baking Intelligence to empower female bakers globally.
Shared key statistics and market research demonstrating the potential and demand for cloud kitchens.
Understanding Cloud Kitchens:

Discussed the concept of cloud kitchens and their advantages, including lower operational costs and increased flexibility.
Addressed common misconceptions and concerns related to cloud kitchen business models.
Benefits of E-Learning for Aspiring Bakers:

Emphasized the convenience and accessibility of online learning, catering to various learning styles.
Showcased the diverse range of courses and resources available on the Baking Intelligence platform.
Platform Features and Tools:

Demonstrated the user-friendly interface of the platform, enabling learners to track progress and engage with interactive content.
Highlighted specialized tools like recipe calculators and cost management modules, designed to facilitate business planning.
Success Stories:

Shared inspiring success stories of female bakers who have utilized Baking Intelligence to establish thriving cloud kitchens.
Provided real-world examples of how the platform has made a positive impact on participants' lives and careers.
Implementation Strategies:

Discussed step-by-step guidance on how aspiring bakers could use Baking Intelligence to initiate and sustain their cloud kitchen ventures.
Outlined potential challenges and recommended best practices to overcome them.
Opportunities for Collaboration:

Explored potential partnerships and collaborations with investors, industry experts, and culinary organizations to further promote Baking Intelligence's mission.
Presentation Highlights:

The presentation received positive feedback and generated significant interest among the audience. Key highlights include:

Engaging Visuals: The presentation was enhanced with captivating visuals, including images of successful bakers and the platform's user interface, which helped maintain audience interest.

Clear Communication: The content was presented in a concise and straightforward manner, ensuring that complex concepts were easily understandable to all attendees.

Interactive Element: Several interactive elements, such as live demonstrations of platform features, elicited active participation and questions from the audience.

Empowering Message: The presentation successfully conveyed the empowerment message of Baking Intelligence, resonating strongly with the audience and showcasing the platform's potential impact on the baking industry.

Conclusion:

In conclusion, the presentation for Baking Intelligence was well-received, effectively communicating the platform's mission to empower female bakers through E-Learning and cloud kitchen ventures. The presentation's engaging content, clear communication, and empowering message contributed to its success in captivating the audience and generating interest in potential collaborations and partnerships.", 'Skills Used': ['Copywriting', '2D Illustration', '2D Motion Graphics', 'App Design', 'Editorial Design', 'Brand Strategy', 'Creative Direction', 'Creative Strategy', 'Brand Design Systems', 'Storytelling', 'UX Research', 'User Behavior Research', 'PowerPoint', 'Figma', 'Microsoft PowerPoint', 'Google Slides']}, {'Title': 'IDEO UX Design', 'Role': 'Senior UX Design', 'Company': 'IDEO', 'Industry': 'Creative Agency', 'Description': '- Spearheaded UX advocacy that led to the redesign of IDEO website
-Used data from Adtech and Marktech to inform UX design decisions
-Led UI design of landing pages and emails for drip campaign using Figma 
-Led the engineering of landing pages and email templates in Hubspot using HTML, CSS and Hubl 
-I established Google Analytics and social media analytics reporting using Google DataStudio to inform the marketing team's decision making 
-Illustrated design ideas in Figma using storyboards, user personas, high-fidelity prototypes, customer journey maps, process flows and sitemaps.
-Redesigned the footer and made CTA improvements on the website
-Used Hubspot workflows to identify Marketing Qualified Leads and Sales Qualified Leads based on their interaction at various touch points in the customer journey map
-Managed the publishing of landing pages for "The Big Question" podcast using Hubspot
-Employed social listening reporting using Meltwater and Google Datastudio', 'Skills Used': ['App Design', 'Graphic Design', 'Visual Website Design', 'Art Direction', 'UI/UX Design Systems', 'Marketing Design', 'UX Design', 'UX Research', 'Adobe Photoshop', 'Webflow', 'Google Slides', 'CSS', 'Figma', 'HTML', 'Microsoft PowerPoint', 'Google Docs', 'PHP']}]

[{'Title': 'Product Designer at Litus Modular Bench', 'Role': 'Product Design', 'Company': 'Litus', 'Industry': 'Real Estate', 'Description': 'Concept

Litus is a modular bench with multiple configurations and is entirely made of travertine, using the waste blocks obtained during the industrial processing of the material. The intent of the project is to reduce production costs, reuse waste material, and reduce the environmental impact of the production process.

Design

The design is simple, minimal, and essential to optimize the use of the raw material and create a geometric product capable of fitting into any context of use. Litus is designed to meet the needs of flexibility and modularity, making it possible to create different configurations and arrangements of the elements, depending on the external environment.

Materials

Travertine, used in two different colors, enriches and characterizes the product through its surface finish, highlighting the material aspect of the furniture and the porosity of the material, which gives each element elegance and uniqueness. The product also has a cylindrical vase made of corten, inserted in the appropriate space, which guarantees a perfect match with travertine enhanced by a circular detail.', 'Skills Used': ['Product Design', '3D Design', '3D Renderings', 'Prototyping', 'Sketch', 'Cinema 4D', 'Adobe Photoshop']}, {'Title': 'Product Designer at Spot One', 'Role': 'Product Design', 'Company': 'Spot One', 'Industry': 'Real Estate', 'Description': "I was tasked to ideate and design a lighting solution for minimal estates in line with the research institute's goal to provide affordable housing.", 'Skills Used': ['Prototyping', 'Product Design', '3D Design', '3D Renderings', 'Sketch', 'Cinema 4D', 'Adobe Photoshop']}, {'Title': 'Product Designer at Zolt', 'Role': 'Product Design', 'Company': 'Zolt', 'Industry': 'Technology', 'Description': 'Charged with the entire product creation process, responsible for discovering and defining a problem, and then empathically designing a solution. The product

Identity & naming

Name: Aluko Ayomiposi
Biography: Business provide value for people and people pay for things they find valuable. My passion lies on the thin line that borders this two ideals. Helping businesses achieve their goals by creating interfaces and experiences that users love.
Projects:
[{'Title': 'Quidax Product Redesign', 'Role': 'Lead Product Designer', 'Company': 'Quidax.com', 'Industry': 'Fintech', 'Description': 'While working at Quidax, one of Africa’s leading cryptocurrency exhange platforms, I led the team of brand designers, product designers & design specialists working across multiple teams to redesign the product’s visual system and to build out new products and features for the company.', 'Skills Used': ['Product Design', 'Mobile Design', 'Mobile UI', 'UI Design', 'Figma', 'Adobe Illustrator']}, {'Title': 'Estate Intel Dashboards & Website', 'Role': 'Product Designer', 'Company': 'Estate Intel', 'Industry': 'Real Estate', 'Description': "In 2018, over 1 Billion naira worth of real estate projects were stalled by weak knowledge of the Nigerian real estate market. While a lot of these data were available on the Estate Intel web application dashboard, accessibility and user experience was poor so users mostly dropped off without achieving their goals.

For over 8 months, I worked on a 6-man team that included 1 project manager, 1 frontend engineer, 2 Backend engineers and the product owner to:

- Redesign the architecture and accessibility of the dashboard.
Improve the user experience of the web application by ensuring that key features are prominent and easily accessible.

- Improve the cohesiveness of both the website's landing page and the web application.

- Improve the look and feel of the website and the web application.", 'Skills Used': ['UX Design', 'Dashboards', 'Wireframes', 'Data Visualization', 'Web UI', 'Figma', 'Adobe Illustrator']}, {'Title': 'YouVerify', 'Role': 'UI/UX Designer', 'Company': 'youverify.co', 'Industry': 'Technology', 'Description': 'I worked with the YouVerify team to build a website that served as a proper extension of the brand as well as highlight the full scope of product and services they offer in a clear and concise manner.', 'Skills Used': ['Web UI', 'Figma']}, {'Title': 'Fundall Visual Redesign', 'Role': 'UI/UX Design', 'Company': 'Fundall.io', 'Industry': 'Fintech', 'Description': "Fundall is the smart digital bank that helps people manage their money by customizing the experience to fit their lifestyle, through their personal information and data. Having served over 10,000 users in its beta mode and preparing for a full launch, there was the need to overhaul the website, web & mobile app to deliver a better experience and capture the brand's identity more intentionally. 

Redesign the website to have a modern look and feel.

Extend the brand identity to the website.

Ensure that the products has a robust architecture to accommodate all the features.", 'Skills Used': ['Product Design', 'UI Design', 'Figma', 'Adobe Illustrator']}, {'Title': 'Sustyvibes Website Design', 'Role': 'UI/UX Designer', 'Company': 'sustyvibes.com', 'Industry': 'Non-Profit', 'Description': 'Sustyvibes is fast becoming an authority and the voice for sustainable development in Nigeria with growing popularity within its major audience—young people. This direction wants to build on that to visually strengthen Sustyvibes position in the minds of people. Using a mix of assertive and hippy messages with modern and vibrant colours, the new brand will seek to establish itself as a force and a voice.

My job was to create a website that truly captures the ideals of sustyvibes and clearly communicates their efforts in changing the narrative of sustainable development in Nigeria.

Redesign the website to have a modern look and feel

Extend the brand identity to the website

Ensure that the important messages about the activities of the organisation are well highlighted on the website.
', 'Skills Used': ['UI Design', 'Visual Website Design', 'Figma', 'Adobe Illustrator']}]

Name: Eric
Biography: I grow brands and products by designing experiences that meet users’ needs, are consistent with the brand, and are strategically crafted to meet business objectives.
Projects:
[{'Title': 'Connect+', 'Role': 'Principal Product Designer', 'Company': 'Acelr8, Berlin', 'Industry': 'SaaS', 'Description': "I delivered a hiring portal with Slack, ATS integration, and an internal tool that increased the client's addressable market and shortened the time to fill openings.

I was responsible for the entire product design process. I conducted user research, including hiring managers and recruiters from Soundcloud, Duolingo, etc as participants.

I created wireframes, user flow maps and low-fidelity designs, on which I conducted usability testing for improvements before going on to deliver high-fidelity designs and fully interactive prototypes.", 'Skills Used': ['UX Design', 'User Flow Design', 'Information Architecture', 'UX Copywriting', 'UI Design', 'Usability Testing', 'Prototyping', 'User Journeys', 'User Research', 'UX Research', 'Slack', 'Figma', 'JIRA', 'Principle', 'Keynote']}, {'Title': 'Improving Patient Experience at Mayo Clinic', 'Role': 'Senior UI Designer', 'Company': 'Mayo Clinic via AKQA, New York', 'Industry': 'Health', 'Description': "I delivered a series of improvements to some Mayo Clinic's core products and services, improving their patient experience, with the following results & impact:

- Improving patient application experience: 48% drop in rejected applications, 60% reduction in time to evaluate applications before a decision is reached.

- Increasing participation in Clinical Trials: Around 80% of trials fail to meet their initial enrollment target and timeline.
The Latinx and African-American population only make up a meagre 1% and 5% of Clinical Trial participants despite making up ~19% and ~13% respectively of the USA population. I designed new approaches which we tested and addressed these shortcomings.

- Promoting Travel Services: 300% increase in number of new patients that utilise Patient Travel Services", 'Skills Used': ['UX Design', 'User Flow Design', 'Information Architecture', 'Brand Strategy', 'UX Copywriting', 'UI Design', 'UX Research', 'Brand Design Systems', 'Figma', 'Sketch', 'Adobe Photoshop', 'Adobe InDesign']}, {'Title': 'Rain Cryptocurrency - Backed by Coinbase', 'Role': 'Web3 Product Designer', 'Company': 'MetaLab, Vancouver', 'Industry': 'Crypto', 'Description': 'I worked extensively on branding, token discovery, the search experience, crypto education, the coin detail pages and a bulk of the transaction pages among other things.

I delivered a unique crypto trading experience that is brand-rich and educates users while giving them what they need to mitigate risk and make token trading decisions.

Deliverables: Mobile trading app, and a web-based Advanced Trading Platform', 'Skills Used': ['UX Design', 'User Flow Design', 'Information Architecture', 'Brand Strategy', 'Interactive Design', 'UI Design', 'Deck Design', 'UI/UX Design Systems', 'Landing Pages', 'Mobile UI', 'Dashboards', 'Slack', 'Figma', 'JIRA', 'Adobe Photoshop', 'Principle']}, {'Title': 'Turbocart eCommerce', 'Role': 'Product Design Lead', 'Company': 'Turbocart', 'Industry': 'E-Commerce', 'Description': 'Designed on-demand shopping experiences across web and mobile platforms for
      • Shopper experience
      • Merchant experience
      • Logistics Management
      • Administrative dashboards and internal systems', 'Skills Used': ['UX Design', 'User Flow Design', 'Brand Strategy', 'Interactive Design', 'UI Design', 'UI/UX Design Systems', 'Visual Website Design', 'Wireframes', 'Landing Pages', 'Mobile UI', 'User Journeys', 'Responsive Web Design', 'User Research', 'Web & App Integrations', 'User Flows', 'Mobile UX', 'Mobile Design', 'Web Design', 'Web UI', 'Prototyping', 'Slack', 'Figma', 'JIRA', 'Google Docs', 'SEO', 'Adobe Photoshop', 'Wordpress', 'Google Slides']}, {'Title': 'Instasite - Website builder', 'Role': 'Lead Product Designer', 'Company': 'Whogohost', 'Industry': 'SaaS', 'Description': 'Working as the only product designer on this aspirational project to deliver a simplified Siteduilder experience, I conducted extensive user research (employing a variety of methods), and charted a series of approaches and user flows, low fidelity wireframes. [{'Title': 'B2B SaaS Photography eCommerce Web App', 'Role': 'Senior Product Design', 'Company': 'ProConnection', 'Industry': 'E-Commerce', 'Description': "Description

Redesign the Crowdcast web app and dashboard and propose a mobile app design that will be engaging, improve the UX, and increase business value.

SOLUTION
An immersive video conferencing experience for users provides features that are curated to serve the exact purpose of their meeting.

I was the sole designer, covering all product design segments and focusing on a slick design and seamless UX. I also worked improving and prototyping the project in Origami Studio.

Filled with excitement and panic we started trying to figure out what we could do to speak to the creative industry and showcase our voice as a company...some crazy and whacky ideas were thrown around and then the idea was sparked... let's make an intro about the creative process to make the intro! Why censor or limit our creativity when there is an open brief presented to peers in our industry? The meta-intro was born! It also gave an opportunity to make it a real team sport roping in most of the graphic department and promo directors to add bits and pieces of content. 
Keeping it fun, crazy, breaking the stereotypes and poking fun at ourselves as creatives all at once. 
This video, paired with our "throw the design books out the window" style of vaporwave design for the other conference deliverables, made for a refreshing, entertaining and fun atmosphere at the event.

Name: Stephen Oluwasanmi
Biography:
Creative brand designer with over seven (7) years of experience.

I believe in strategy-led design and excel at understanding and translating complex business needs, goals, and, objectives into compelling brand design that drives results.
Projects:
[{'Title': "Aunty Helen's Pot Rebrand", 'Role': 'Brand Design, Brand Strategy, Art Direction', 'Company': "Aunty Helen's Pot", 'Industry': 'Food', 'Description': "I coducted a rebrand initiative for Aunty Helen's Pot that focused on capturing the essence of the brand and amplifying and communicating its core values to it's target customers. After conducting a strategy workshop with the stakeholders, we identified the unique selling points of the brand, its personality, and its target audience.

My goal was to create a brand identity that would speak to the traditional, home-cooked feel of Aunty Helen's Pot, while also modernizing its image and making it more attractive to a wider range of consumers.

I developed a new logo and visual brand identity assets that were simple, elegant, and memorable.  The brand colors were vivid, sensual, and inviting, giving the brand a modern feel. The hand-drawn typography helped convert the natural and organic feel of the brand.

I also created marketing materials that were consistent with the new brand identity, such as social media posts, banner ads, and packaging designs. My approach was to use the new brand identity to create a cohesive look and feel across all customer touchpoints.

Overall, the rebranding efforts for Aunty Helen's Pot helped enhance the brand's reputation and expand its reach to a wider audience while retaining its unique values.", 'Skills Used': ['Creative Direction', 'Art Direction', 'Brand Guidelines', 'Creative Strategy', '2D Motion Graphics', 'Logo Design', 'Layout Design', 'Package Design', 'Social Media Campaigns', 'Motion Design', '2D Animation', 'Social Media Graphics', 'Marketing Collateral', 'Digital Content', 'Brand Collateral', 'Brand Design Systems', 'Brand Strategy', 'Identity Design', 'Brand Design', 'Marketing Design', 'Social Media Design', 'Wireframes', 'Label Design', 'Banner Ads', 'Ad Campaigns', 'Personas', 'Adobe Photoshop', 'Adobe After Effects', 'Figma', 'Adobe Illustrator', 'Adobe InDesign', 'Canva']}, {'Title': 'Ligada Rebrand', 'Role': 'Brand Design, Brand Strategy, Art Direction', 'Company': 'Ligada', 'Industry': 'Real Estate', 'Description': "For this rebranding project for Ligada, My first step was to conduct a strategy workshop with the stakeholders to identify the brand's core values and the goal of the engagement. Based on this information, I designed a new logo and brand identity assets for the company that would convey its commitment to innovation, quality, and reliability.

I chose dynamic and energetic brand colors that convey a sense of trust and reliability. I also extended the new brand identity into materials for marketing, social, and communications, creating a cohesive look and feel across all customer touchpoints.

Overall, my rebranding efforts helped to reposition Ligada as a forward-thinking, innovative company that customers could rely on for reliable real estate solutions. I'm proud to have helped the brand enhance its reputation and expand its reach to a wider audience while retaining its unique values and identity.", 'Skills Used': ['Creative Direction', 'Art Direction', 'Brand Guidelines', 'Presentation Design', 'Graphic Design', 'Logo Design', 'Social Media Campaigns', 'Graphics', 'Social Media Graphics', 'Deck Design', 'Personas', 'Marketing Collateral', 'Brand Collateral', 'Brand Design Systems', 'Brand Strategy', 'Identity Design', 'Brand Design', 'Marketing Design', 'Social Media Design', 'Visual Identity', 'Banner Ads', 'Ad Campaigns', 'Email Templates', 'Corporate Identity Design', 'Brochure Design', 'Project Management', 'Adobe Photoshop', 'Microsoft PowerPoint', 'Adobe Illustrator', 'Keynote', 'Adobe InDesign']}, {'Title': "Hephzibah Atelier's Brand Design", 'Role': 'Brand Identity Designer', 'Company': 'Hephzibah Atelier', 'Industry': 'Fashion', 'Description': "I had the pleasure of working with Hephzibah Atelier, a high-end fashion and accessories brand, to design its visual brand identity. 

I started out by conducting a discovery strategy session where I reviewed the new brand's mission, target audience, and competition. Through the discovery session, I gained valuable insights into the brand's values, personality, and positioning, as well as the positioning to reflect that.

Next, I developed a logo design process that included several rounds of ideation and refinement, creating several rough sketches of possible logo designs that would reflect the brand's vision and personality. Then, I narrowed down the options to a few top contenders and refined them further by adding color, experimenting with typography, and tweaking the overall composition.

With that understanding, I created several sketches for the logo design process that would represent TCE's mission and approachable personality. Projects:
[{'Title': 'Hive Wallet Gamification', 'Role': 'Visual Designer', 'Company': 'Honeycoin', 'Industry': 'Crypto', 'Description': 'Gamification can be used to improve user experience by making tasks or activities more engaging and rewarding. 
Gamification can make tasks or activities more enjoyable and rewarding for users, which can lead to increased engagement and satisfaction.

I designed the user experience, illustration assets, and user interface design for the Hive Game Center', 'Skills Used': ['2D Illustration', '3D Illustration', 'Game UI Design', 'UI/UX Design Systems', 'Figma', 'Adobe Illustrator']}, {'Title': 'Vaccinex', 'Role': 'Product Designer', 'Company': 'Personal Project', 'Industry': 'Healthtech', 'Description': 'The COVID-19 pandemic. We know the story... 

The pandemic meant that no travel was risk-free anymore. Many countries implemented measures like social distancing and travel restrictions, and many companies adopted the work-from-home policy. 

With time, vaccines were created and distributed worldwide to help combat the spread of the “virus”.

In Nigeria, the NCDC (National Center for Disease Control) together with the Ministry of Health accredited a number of health centers across the country where people could go for their COVID-19 vaccination.

The goal was to design a mobile user interface to allow users to discover COVID-19 vaccination centers near them, contact and schedule appointments.', 'Skills Used': ['UI/UX Design Systems', 'Mobile Design', 'Figma']}, {'Title': "Ify's Kitchen ", 'Role': 'Product Designer', 'Company': 'iQubeLabs', 'Industry': 'Food', 'Description': 'Ify’s Kitchen has been able to estalish itself as a reputable brand in the food industry through the publishing of content and tutorials across various social media platforms.

Due to the ever evolving nature of the industry, the brand thought it necessary to expand by building a product that helps it leverage existing fanbase, stay relevant and generate revenue. The product would serve as an exclusive engagement hub for all Ify’s kitchen clients, fans, and followers, housing content and delivering classes in a centralized space for a tailored experience and easy access (instead of hosting this content scattered across other platforms). 

The goal is to design a robust on-demand content platform that prioritizes a great user experience from content discovery to purchase and participation.
', 'Skills Used': ['Mobile Design', 'UI/UX Design Systems', 'Web Design', 'Figma']}, {'Title': 'Webcop Web Design', 'Role': 'Product Designer', 'Company': 'Webcop', 'Industry': 'SaaS', 'Description': 'In many countries, especially the United States, website owners are being targeted for multiple compliance issues. As website accessibility lawsuits hit record levels, non-compliance is no longer an option. 

Webcop is a tool that helps you check whether your website is unknowingly breaking the law. It checks that a website is GPDR & ADA compliant, does not fail plagiarism tests or breaks Image & video copyright laws. It finds where the website fails the compliance test or is susceptible to a lawsuit &  then provides the tools needed to fix it.

The goal is to make it seamless for users to check for their website compliance and fix it. ', 'Skills Used': ['Web Design', 'Visual App Design', 'Figma']}]

Name: Geneza Brands
Biography: Geneza Brands specializes in crafting robust brand identities for both organizations and individuals. Our passion is rooted in creating memorable brand experiences that cultivate meaningful connections with customers.
Projects:
[{'Title': 'Brand Identity Design for ThePeer', 'Role': 'Design Agency', 'Company': 'Thepeer', 'Industry': 'Fintech', 'Description': "We created a new brand identity for Thepeer, a technology infrastructure for businesses to easily integrate and enable them to support fast, direct, and efficient transactions across businesses.

As part of Thepeer's rebranding efforts, we created an identity system that emphasized the brand's high-quality, vibrancy, stability, and customer focus. This necessitated a change from the prior, conservative brand designs to one that was more vivid, more memorable, and more clearly defined.

For clear and concise brand messaging and to maintain Thepeer's reputation for exceptional quality, we created a custom typeface called Thepeer Sans. Thepeer Sans is a unique font that is hand-drawn, neat, and has each letter crafted in a geometric, san-serif structure that is simple to read and pleasing to the eye.", 'Skills Used': ['Brand Design', 'Brand Design Systems', '2D Illustration', '2D Animation', 'Brand Illustration', 'Icon Design', 'Adobe Photoshop', 'Adobe Illustrator', 'Adobe After Effects']}, {'Title': 'Brand Identity Design for Consonance', 'Role': 'Brand Design Agency', 'Company': 'Consonance', 'Industry': 'Finance', 'Description': "Consonance is an early-stage and growth investing platform focused on leveraging Africa’s economic growth opportunities by backing profitable and sustainable enterprises across Sub-Saharan Africa. Founded in 2017, and on a mission to secure Africa’s future, Consonance's core principles of quality teamwork, flexibility, Client appreciation, and long-term and hands-on investments, ensure efficient leveraging of Africa’s greatest resource; her human capital.

Consonance embraces people, relationships, and intellectual capital; knowing these are essentially the heart and soul of every thriving economy. Geneza picked up on this important facet, choosing to reflect it in a logo that perfectly encapsulates the relationship dynamic between Consonance and its clients.


The Consonance logo; an important part of the brand, conveys a brand promise and identity that resonates with its name. Designed to resemble a Mobius strip, which is a perfect mathematical reflection of seamless synergy, the logo represents the perfect inter-relationship between consonance and its most important asset; its clients and their businesses. Consonance has a deep commitment to Africa; using an experienced, intellectually independent, and honest team to assess and invest in various financially, environmentally, and socially sustainable market opportunities in Africa for Africans.
Geneza took this to heart, choosing 2 distinct color hues to symbolize this commitment to African entrepreneurs and enterprises. A vibrant Reddish-Orange synonymous with the iron-rich Sub-Saharan soil and a solid black to represents the unique African melanin-rich skin. We aptly named these eye-catching hues Consonance Clay and Consonance Black, serving as the Brand’s primary colors and giving Consonance a visually appealing outlook that reflects its roots and its focus. Following this brand architecture, Geneza chose a unique Typeface; PP Neue Machina for its deep ink geometric type features perfectly suited to reflect innovation. DM sans, a low-contrast geometric sans serif design, serves as the secondary brand typeface. Both fonts together are a perfect geometric pairing.", 'Skills Used': ['2D Illustration', 'Brand Design', 'Brand Design Systems', '3D Animation', 'Adobe Photoshop', 'Adobe Illustrator', 'Adobe After Effects']}, {'Title': 'Packaging design for Grello', 'Role': 'Brand Design Agency', 'Company': 'Grello', 'Industry': 'Food', 'Description': "This case study showcases the packaging design for Grello, a brand specializing in oat-based donuts and protein bars. The packaging needed to differentiate Grello from competitors, create brand recognition, and provide essential product information in a clear and attractive manner.", 'Skills Used': ['Brand Design', 'Brand Illustration', 'Brand Design Systems', 'Adobe Photoshop', 'Adobe Illustrator', 'Adobe After Effects']}, {'Title': 'Packaging Design for Lilly Skincare line', 'Role': 'Brand Design Agency', 'Company': 'Lilly Skincare', 'Industry': 'Beauty', 'Description': "Lilly Women's Health offers personalized, comprehensive, and preventive breast care services through a state-of-the-art facility operated by Harvard-educated and internationally trained breast care specialists.

Name: Justin Archer
Biography: I'm a freelance director & animator and I lead bespoke teams of freelancers to create animated videos to best engage with audiences.
Projects:
[{'Title': 'Bashwax Showreel', 'Role': 'Director & Animator', 'Company': 'Bashwax', 'Industry': 'Advertising', 'Description': 'Latest reel showcasing some of my favourite collaborative projects from the past two years.', 'Skills Used': ['3D Animation', '2D Animation', '2D Motion Graphics', '2D Illustration', '2D Motion Graphics', '3D Motion Graphics', '3D Illustration', 'Creative Direction', 'Adobe Photoshop', 'Cinema 4D', 'Adobe After Effects', 'Adobe Premiere', 'Adobe Illustrator', 'Adobe Audition']}, {'Title': 'Unpluq', 'Role': 'Director & Animator', 'Company': 'Bashwax', 'Industry': 'Technology', 'Description': 'Addiction to social media is widespread, with constant notifications and interactions keeping us glued to our phones. We think we’re in control but these platforms are designed to manipulate our behavior without our conscious awareness.

Unpluq is an app that requires users to complete a task before accessing their chosen apps. By adding an extra step, Unpluq encourages users to question their behavior and resist the urge to mindlessly reach for their phones.

We were tasked with getting this message across as quickly as possible using visuals and sounds that trigger most of our own habit loops. We are all familiar with binging apps on our phone without intention so we wanted to show just how helpful an app like Unpluq can be to put a barrier in-between for us to stop and consider.

To promote Unpluq we created a video which would communicate this message through familiar visuals and sounds that trigger these habit loops. We wanted to show just how easy it is to get sucked into bingeing apps on our phones and show the value of putting a barrier in place to pause and reflect on our usage.', 'Skills Used': ['2D Animation', '3D Animation', '2D Motion Graphics', '3D Animation', '2D Motion Graphics', 'Storyboarding', 'Cinema 4D', 'Adobe After Effects', 'Adobe Illustrator', 'Adobe Premiere Pro']}, {'Title': 'Plentify Hotbot', 'Role': 'Animator & Director', 'Company': 'Bashwax', 'Industry': 'Technology', 'Description': 'Hotbot, developed by Plentify, is a smart energy-saving device that helps you control your geyser and shift electricity usage during peak hours when South Africa’s electricity grid struggles the most. With Hotbot, you don’t need to manually switch your geyser on and off. It prioritises hot water according to your preferences while finding the best time to save energy.

We worked with Plentify to animate a very short video to promote Hotbot on various social media channels. The challenge was to showcase the problem they solve in a brief format which would fit all aspect ratios for various social media channels.

Name: Yahya Umar
Biography: I'm a creative explorer, embracing diverse industries and collaborating with exceptional individuals. My "mind system" fuses disciplines for innovative solutions. Fueled by passion and curiosity, I thrive in growth-oriented environments.
Projects:
[{'Title': '429tever Brand Identity Design', 'Role': 'Brand Designer', 'Company': '429tever', 'Industry': 'Fintech', 'Description': '429tever is a leading fintech company that specializes in money security, escrow, and blockchain services. Our mission is to provide reliable and innovative financial solutions to individuals and businesses in Africa.

Problem: In Africa, financial fraud and scams are rampant, making it difficult for people to trust online transactions. 429tever solves this problem by offering secure and reliable money security, escrow, and blockchain services that give users peace of mind when transacting online.

Features and Benefits: Our money security services protect users from fraud by providing secure payment options and encryption technology. Our escrow services offer a neutral third party to hold funds until both parties agree that the transaction has been completed successfully. This eliminates the risk of fraud and ensures that both parties are satisfied with the transaction. Our blockchain services offer secure and transparent transactions that are immutable and cannot be altered, ensuring that every transaction is trustworthy.', 'Skills Used': ['Brand Design', 'Creative Direction', 'Brand Illustration', '2D Animation', 'Graphic Design', 'Adobe Photoshop', 'Adobe Illustrator', 'Adobe InDesign', 'Adobe After Effects']}, {'Title': 'BootX Identity Design', 'Role': 'Brand Designer, Creative Director', 'Company': 'BootX', 'Industry': 'Sports', 'Description': 'Overview

Boot X design brief Boot X is a new Football Boot Exchange that enables local communities to buy, sell, or donate boots to support sustainable practices in football, aid participation in the sport during the cost of living crisis, and raise money for grassroots football initiatives. Boot X is entering the proof of concept phase partnering with a local grassroots football club to help them raise funds for the building of a new artificial football pitch. Although the proof of concept will focus on Football Boots, the longer-term vision is to open the platform up to list all football-based equipment and be a transferable model that can be used across different grassroots sports.

Our mission is to make buying used football boots and equipment not only acceptable but a desirable thing to do as well as a fulfilling experience. We want the users of the service to feel like they are getting a good quality product from a premium brand and create something that becomes a viable alternative option to buying new. We feel this is possible following the lead of brands like Back Market and Depop that have managed to redefine this category.


Requirements

Boot X requires the design of a brand logo that will have focused usage in the early phases of this project. Boot X stock will initially only be listed on Instagram and at this proof of concept phase it is unlikely there will be any further digital touchpoints. Ideally, we would have a logomark that is usable as a watermark on the images of what is posted on Instagram and if there is any continuation of the logo mark that can form a visual language that can be overlaid on Instagram posts that would be desirable. We are also looking to pair the logo mark with a tagline and some example taglines have been included below. We would like the ability to tweak when needed as our messaging evolves and therefore this would probably be best in a font that sits alongside the core logo mark.', 'Skills Used': ['Creative Direction', 'Brand Design Systems', 'Brand Illustration', '2D Animation', 'Brand Design', 'Adobe After Effects', 'Adobe Illustrator', 'Adobe InDesign', 'Adobe Photoshop']}, {'Title': 'A1 Athletics Brand Identity Design', 'Role': 'Brand Designer, Creative Director', 'Company': 'A1 Athletics', 'Industry': 'Fitness', 'Description': 'A1 Athletics had a vision for their logo that embodied the qualities of being bold and fast, drawing inspiration from active performance. We worked closely with them to create a lettermark that captured these ideals, resulting in a design that is sharp and dynamic. To enhance the overall aesthetic, we selected a remarkable font that aligned perfectly with the angle of the number 1 in A1. The final mark was meticulously crafted to convey a sense of athleticism and power, ensuring it was weighty and easily legible.', 'Skills Used': ['Brand Design', 'Brand Illustration', 'Icon Design', 'Graphic Design', 'Adobe Photoshop', 'Adobe Illustrator', 'Adobe InDesign', 'Adobe After Effects']}, {'Title': 'Monster Bat Brand Design', 'Role': 'Brand Designer', 'Company': 'Monster Bat', 'Industry': 'Sports', 'Description': 'The sleek logo design features a fusion of a monster and a bat, representing the brand's unique and fierce identity. The cutting-edge typography with sharp edges, inspired by bat membranes, adds an edgy and modern touch to the overall design.

Drawing inspiration from the DNA of a bat, the wordmark has been thoughtfully designed to convey agility, adaptability, and mystery. Its simplicity ensures a responsible, memorable, and timeless representation of the brand.

I have carefully selected a vibrant color palette to reflect the brand's energy and passion. The bold shades of red symbolize power, while the complementary gray and black bring sophistication and strength to the visual identity.

Incorporating elements of bat wings into the letterforms, particularly the extended "M" and "T," adds a touch of grace and fluidity, paying homage to the world of bat sports. These subtle yet impactful details make the brand's identity truly unique.

My brand design for Monster Bat is not only visually appealing but strategically crafted to resonate with the target audience. By combining strength, innovation, and a relentless pursuit of excellence, I have created a brand identity that inspires athletes to push their boundaries and embrace their inner beast.', 'Skills Used': ['Brand Design', 'Brand Illustration', 'Adobe Photoshop', 'Adobe Illustrator']}]

[{'Title': 'Klasha App V.1 - Borderless payments in Africa', 'Role': 'Product Designer ', 'Company': 'Klasha Technologies', 'Industry': 'Fintech', 'Description': 'I spearheaded various crucial tasks to simplify cross-border payments for Africans. By conducting extensive user research, including surveys and interviews, I gained insights into the challenges users faced with traditional bank cards, with 82% reporting difficulties in making international payments.

Dinma is a product designer who solves complex problems, drives measurable growth and helps product teams achieve their goals. 

Recently at Shopify, she led a project that increased barcode coverage to 96.97% within Shopify Logistics.
Projects:
[{'Title': 'Support Multiple industry-standard barcodes', 'Role': 'Product Designer', 'Company': 'Shopify', 'Industry': 'E-Commerce', 'Description': 'Problem: During SFN (​​Shopify fulfilment Network) product induction, 77% of Barcodes were identified as missing or duplicates, requiring merchant updates prior to onboarding. Additionally, supporting multiple industry-standard barcodes was crucial for achieving the Q1-2023 milestone and establishing a solid foundation for long-term growth.

My role: I led the end-to-end design of this project and was responsible for Visual design, User research and UX design

Impact of the project
Led the design of this project, which enabled 7,325 merchants to easily add multiple industry-standard barcodes to a total of 230,764 products in their stores, with 0 duplicates.
I designed error validation and helper text that significantly decreased barcode errors, resulting in increased barcode completion rates and achieving a barcode coverage of 96.97%. 
The features I designed played a crucial role in helping Shopify Logistics achieve its Q1 migration goal.

Name: Nosakhare Iyamu
Biography: Hi, I'm Nosa, a technology-driven designer passionate about improving lives through design solutions. I specialize in bridging the gap between design and technology, humanizing the elements for a better user experience.
Projects:
[{'Title': 'Smarthealth ', 'Role': 'Product Designer', 'Company': 'Interswitch Group eClat', 'Industry': 'Healthtech', 'Description': 'Overview: Smarthealth is a complete wellness companion. It connects you to information you need to stay healthy; and prompt medical help when you need it. The product is hinged on the new patient paradigm which enables healthcare stakeholders provide remote, personalized treatment to patients via a connected and continuous care pathway.

Problem statement: Patients experience poor/epileptic healthcare today because of existing cyclical, reactive and disconnected  palliative healthcare.

Challenge: Bridge the gap between technology and palliative healthcare, encouraging a preventive, connected and continuous healthcare delivery and validate the role of technology in healthcare.

Solution: Using data analytical methods to better understand this health tech landscape. Properly gather and comprehend patient data.

Results: Mobile and web app for patients and Doctors. 10million Naira in recurring revenue, 54 Telemedicine sign ups, 50+ Telehealth sessions concluded, etc.', 'Skills Used': ['UI/UX Design Systems', 'UX Design', 'UX Research', 'User Behavior Research', 'Mobile Design', 'Illustration', 'Adobe Photoshop', 'Figma', 'Google Docs', 'Adobe Illustrator']}, {'Title': "Cappa & D'Alberto Website redesign", 'Role': 'UX Design', 'Company': "Cappa & D'Alberto PLC", 'Industry': 'Real Estate', 'Description': "Overview:
Cappa and D’Alberto Plc is a leading building and civil engineering contracting firm in Nigeria, with nearly 90 years of experience and grounded repute in the engineering and construction industry built on its history, professionalism and commitment to service. it is nearing a century of unparalleled expertise, making it the oldest and one of the most prominent companies in the Nigerian construction industry today.

Problem:
Borne out of a need to promote relevance and maintain superiority in the engineering and construction industry in Nigeria, Strong digital presence is the key in our highly competitive environment and Cappa and D’Alberto wanted to revamp their digital presence in order to attract potential clients and position themselves as a pioneer in this industry. The current website was plagued with outdated information, the design didn’t reflect the company's brand and failed to showcase their rich history. It amplified confusion rather than coherence.

Design process:
When you have a number of business requirements, constraints and politics, a structured approach is required. Design thinking with a proper kick-off allowed me to define a workable process. I looked for a few precedents before delving too far into the design process. I made sure to frame a problem area, collect requirements and analyse the context of use.

I started off the project by investigating internal (company) and external (users) drivers to crystallise the area of a potential solution, outlining how the website should work, but not how it should look.First things first, I spent a few workshop sessions with key stakeholders (the business) to learn about their vision for the company and figure out what they need from us. In order for us to design something worth creating for them, we needed an understanding of internal: business needs, requirements, goals; external: context, competitors and best practices.

Design:
‍Putting it all together
The new website design features a modern and professional layout that effectively showcases the company's services and projects. The navigation has been streamlined to make it easier for users to find the information they are looking for. We also added a contact form and clearly displayed the company's contact information to make it easy for potential clients to get in touch. After creating the wireframe and structuring the sitemap, i moved on the designing the interface.", 'Skills Used': ['UX Design', 'UX Research', 'Visual Website Design', 'Figma', 'Adobe Photoshop']}, {'Title': 'Roomy', 'Role': 'UX Designer', 'Company': 'Conceptual', 'Industry': 'Real Estate', 'Description': 'Designing a digital solution that helps provide people with an online platform free of broker listings where they could browse potential accommodations and roommates in real-time and interact directly with them.

I began by designing a logo that served as a randomizer for generating discussion topics, going beyond common mental health issues to include day-to-day occurrences. Typography played a crucial role in expressing inclusivity, with different weights representing gender-specific conversations.

The impact of the visual system was significant, as it created a cohesive and engaging experience across various touchpoints. [{'Title': 'Voyance Vision', 'Role': 'Product Designer', 'Company': 'Voyance', 'Industry': 'SaaS', 'Description': "As the lead designer on the project from February to November 2021, I was responsible for driving the overall design direction and creating all significant deliverables. In addition to my design responsibilities, I worked closely with the diverse in-house teams to ensure that the design elements were effectively integrated into the project. This included collaborating with project managers to ensure that the design was aligned with the project roadmap, working with data scientists and engineers to ensure that the design took into account the technical limitations and requirements, and working with frontend and backend developers to ensure that the design was implemented accurately and efficiently.

Throughout the project, I also had the opportunity to work directly with the CEO, who is a software and machine learning engineer. This allowed me to gain a deeper understanding of the technical aspects of the project and ensured that my design work was grounded in a strong foundation of technical knowledge and expertise. Overall, my work on the project helped drive the project's success by ensuring that all design elements were carefully considered and integrated seamlessly into the overall project plan.", 'Skills Used': ['Wireframing', 'Information Architecture', 'Landing Page Design', 'UI/UX Design Systems', 'UX Research', 'UX Design', 'Figma', 'Adobe After Effects']}, {'Title': 'Dojah Webapp Redesign (B2B SaaS)', 'Role': 'Product Designer', 'Company': 'Dojah', 'Industry': 'B2B', 'Description': 'I played a significant role in the redesign of the Dojah web application, leading the project twice. The first round was between June 2021 and July 2022, and I returned in May 2022 due to a company rebranding. Throughout the project, I worked closely with a team of designers, product managers, engineers, and data scientists. Our main goal was to improve the visual design and user experience, ultimately creating a revised application that met our users' needs​.

Here are some of the key contributions I made during this project:

Improving the Information Architecture: I identified a problem with the application's information architecture that made it difficult for users to locate specific features. To resolve this, I led the effort to restructure the information and revamp the navigation system, making it more intuitive and user-friendly​.

Introducing Quick Actions: I noticed that some users were neglecting important tasks related to the onboarding process. To address this, I introduced a "Quick Actions" page that allowed users to easily access important features and provided a to-do list for new users. This step helped to increase user engagement and ensure compliance with necessary tasks​.

Addressing Missing APIs: To reduce the volume of calls to our customer support team related to discrepancies in the number of APIs and wallet balances displayed on user dashboards, I implemented a modal with a five-second countdown. This feature reminded users of the environment they were logged into, which significantly reduced related customer support calls​.

Improving the Filter: I reworked the filter feature, which was a vital part of our application, by collapsing it into a single modal. This redesign ensured that the filter would scale successfully as the need arose​.

Easy Lookup: The Easy Lookup feature needed a better user experience, so I reworked the flow into a more compact and easy-to-navigate design. This feature allows businesses to look up details of their customers using regulatory IDs​​.

Redesigning Results Display: I optimized and redesigned how results were displayed to make them easier to read or glance through, enhancing the overall user experience​.

Testing and Launch: Alongside my team, we ran internal tests and also some tests with a few of our existing users. After receiving positive feedback and making necessary adjustments, we launched the new UI on August 20, 2022.

Overall, my contributions were pivotal in the successful redesign of the Dojah web application. My approach was grounded in a deep understanding of user needs, a thoughtful approach to problem-solving, and effective collaboration with a diverse team.', 'Skills Used': ['UI/UX Design Systems', 'Web UI', 'UX Research', 'Prototyping', 'Figma', 'Google Docs', 'Adobe']}, {'Title': 'Building Vo 2.0 Design System', 'Role': 'Head of Design', 'Company': 'Voyance', 'Industry': 'B2B', 'Description': "Establishment of Vo 1.0: When I joined Voyance as a product designer in September 2020, there was no existing design system. Recognizing the inconsistencies in our design process, I collaborated with the Head of Design to develop Vo 1.0. This initial design system, which we named after our company, created a library of reusable components and helped introduce consistency in our design and engineering processes.

Identifying and Addressing System Shortcomings: After the departure of the former Head of Design, I stepped into the role and began refining Vo. It quickly became apparent that there were two significant mistakes we had made with Vo 1.0: we didn't include our front-end developers during the design phase, and we neglected to include the input of our brand designers and marketing managers. To correct these oversights, I led efforts to integrate these stakeholders into the design system process.

Research and Insight Gathering: To ensure our design system catered to the needs of all stakeholders, I initiated a research phase with our Associate Product Designer, Aderinsola. We conducted interviews with our internal teams to better understand the problems they encountered with Vo 1.0 and gathered their suggestions for improvements.

Setting Goals and Crafting a New Approach for Vo 2.0: Following our research, I guided the team in setting high-level goals for Vo 2.0. We sought to build a structured and guided way to construct our products, improve design and development speed, ensure consistency for our users, and create continuity for future hires.

Utilizing Figma and an Atomic Design Approach: I led the team in employing Figma for our design work and adopted an atomic approach to our design process, ensuring changes to the smallest unit could affect the larger components in a structured manner.

UI Audit and Inventory: Together with two designers, two front-end engineers, and some marketing designers, we audited our existing design system and created an inventory of patterns and components used across all our products.

Leading the Redesign Process and Stakeholder Involvement: As we redesigned the system, I took the lead in promoting understanding and co-ownership throughout the process, regularly presenting updates and progress reports to the wider team.

Revising the Colour System: Recognizing that our colour system was too complex and inconsistent, I spearheaded the effort to simplify and standardize our colour system.

Improving Typography: I identified issues with our existing typefaces, specifically their inconsistent appearance at smaller sizes. After conducting extensive research, I decided on Aeonik Pro as our primary font and Aeonik Mono as the secondary font to ensure legibility across all screen sizes.

Optimizing Button Design: Finally, based on the patterns we observed in our use of buttons, I led efforts to revise our button designs in Vo 2.0, reducing the number of button sizes from three to two for simplicity and efficiency.
